item.title: {Guides} Clash Online {Guide 1 ETA 2 Hours}
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
Town II Shop

  • Small HP Potion(10 HP) - 20 SC
  • Small MP Potion(10 MP) - 20 SC
  • Crafting Stand - 5000 SC (Mmmm?)
  • Water - 10 SC
  • Bread - 10 SC
  • Small Blue HP Potion (+60 HP) - 80 SC
  • Small Blue MP Potion (+40 MP) - 80 SC
  • Glass Bottle - 10 SC
  • Fire Enchant Scroll - 100 SC
  • Water Enchant Scroll - 100 SC
  • Wind Enchant Scroll - 100 SC
  • Earth Enchant Scroll - 100 SC
  • Stack of 10 Arrows - 50 SC
  • Adventurer’s Lance - 500 SC (5 Mt - Initial Crush)
  • Adventurer’s Chain and Sickle - 500 SC (3 Mt - Hand of Bleeding)
  • Adventurer’s Knuckles - 500 SC (8 Mt - Initial Crush)
  • Adventurer’s Sword - 500 SC (6 Mt - Initial Crush)
  • Adventurer’s Bow - 500 SC (4 Mt- Physical STR )
  • Adventurer’s Staff - 500 SC (4 Mt- Magic Damage Plus)
  • Adventurer’s Gun - 500 SC (4 Mt)
  • Adventurer’s Armor - 1000 SC (Increases DEF by 4%)
  • Adventurer’s Hat - 500 SC (Increases DEF by 1%)
  • Iron Helmet - 1000 SC (Increases DEF by 2%)
  • Adventurer’s Leggings - 1000 SC (Increases DEF by 2%)
  • Adventurer’s Shoes - 1000 SC (Unbreakable)
  • House - 10000 SC (Indestructible)
    NPCs available
    George Shopkeeper.

Tavern

  • Bowl of Rice - 20 SC (Restores your HP and MP)
  • Vegetables - 20 SC (Restores your HP and MP)
  • Meatballs - 40 SC (Restores your HP and MP, Increases Attack by 5%)
  • 1 Bottle of Wine - 200 SC (Restores HP by 300, +10% Attack HIT rate. If drunk by minors, give Drunkeness Status effect. If under Drunkeness, grant 100% Attack Strength. Drinking too much may also cause Drunkeness.)
  • Cooking Utensils - 1000 SC (Contains a Kitchen Knife, 1 Small Pot, 1 Big Pot and a Ladle.)
  • Mashed Potato - 50 SC - (Increases Max HP by 50 for a short period of time.)
    People available
    Umu Umu???
    Jack Assassin of Black.
    Dieg Expert Swordsman

Umu, what is Drunkeness? You… wouldn’t want to know… I had nasty experiences with that…

Drunkeness is a mixture of Confusion, Charm. It may be… a little nasty if afflicted on someone. But hey, it’s only through wine, so it’s okay. Eh? Gosh darn it.

Read full topic
